trans-unit.target: Using the Docker VM Extension for Linux on Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes Docker and the Azure Virtual Machines extensions, and shows how to programmatically create Virtual Machines on Azure that are docker hosts from the command line using the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Describes Docker and the Azure Virtual Machines extensions, and shows how to programmatically create Virtual Machines on Azure that are docker hosts from the command line using the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure Command-line Interface (Azure CLI)
trans-unit.target: Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure Command-line Interface (Azure CLI)

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create a VM with the Docker VM Extension from the service management (asm) mode in Azure CLI on any platform.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create a VM with the Docker VM Extension from the service management (asm) mode in Azure CLI on any platform.

trans-unit.source: [Docker](https://www.docker.com/) is one of the most popular virtualization approaches that uses [Linux containers](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LXC) rather than virtual machines as a way of isolating data and computing on shared resources.
trans-unit.target: [Docker](https://www.docker.com/) is one of the most popular virtualization approaches that uses [Linux containers](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LXC) rather than virtual machines as a way of isolating data and computing on shared resources.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Docker VM extension to the [Azure Linux Agent](virtual-machines-linux-agent-user-guide.md) to create a Docker VM that hosts any number of containers for your applications on Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Docker VM extension to the [Azure Linux Agent](virtual-machines-linux-agent-user-guide.md) to create a Docker VM that hosts any number of containers for your applications on Azure.

trans-unit.target: To see a high-level discussion of containers and their advantages, see the [Docker High Level Whiteboard](http://channel9.msdn.com/Blogs/Regular-IT-Guy/Docker-High-Level-Whiteboard).

trans-unit.source: To use the Docker VM extension with Azure, you must install a version of the [Azure Command-Line Interface](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-tools-xplat) (Azure CLI) higher than 0.8.6 (as of this writing the current version is 0.8.10).

trans-unit.source: Docker Host VM Authentication
trans-unit.target: Docker Host VM Authentication

trans-unit.source: In addition to creating the Docker VM, the `azure vm docker create` command also automatically creates the necessary certificates to allow your Docker client computer to connect to the Azure container host using HTTPS, and the certificates are stored on both the client and host machines, as appropriate.
trans-unit.target: In addition to creating the Docker VM, the `azure vm docker create` command also automatically creates the necessary certificates to allow your Docker client computer to connect to the Azure container host using HTTPS, and the certificates are stored on both the client and host machines, as appropriate.

trans-unit.source: On subsequent runs, the existing certificates are reused and shared with the new host.
trans-unit.target: On subsequent runs, the existing certificates are reused and shared with the new host.

trans-unit.source: By default, certificates are placed in `~/.docker`, and Docker will be configured to run on port **2376**.
trans-unit.target: By default, certificates are placed in `~/.docker`, and Docker will be configured to run on port **2376**.

trans-unit.target: The Docker daemon on the host is configured to listen for and authenticate client connections on the specified port using the certificates generated by the `azure vm docker create` command.
